instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize SSD
threads.message:
There was oxidation on the <CHIP>U8070</CHIP>, I replaced it, but it still doesn't recognize it. The <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FET_R</SIGNAL> with the SSD is 1.2v and without the SSD 2.4v. I've already changed it twice.

<CHIP>U8070</CHIP>
1 - 3.3v
2 - 3v
5 - 1.2v with SSD - 2.4v without SSD
7 -3.3v

<CHIP>U3740</CHIP>
With SSD
1 - 3.4v
2 - 0.3v
3 - 3v
4 - 0
6 - 3v
7 - 1.1v
8 - 0

No SSD
1 - 3.4v
2 - 0.6v
3 - 3v
4 - 0
6 - 3v
7 - 2v
8 - 3v

Any tips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize SSD
threads.message:
Do you also have 3.3V at pin 3/<CHIP>U8070</CHIP>?
If yes, then bad chip; may also have bad solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize SSD
threads.message:
Yes, I have 3.3v pin 3.

I'll change it one more time. I've already tested with two.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize SSD
threads.message:
I changed the <CHIP>U8070</CHIP> twice more and it worked.

I'm taking it out of scrap, because I don't have it new.
